Anemia is a condition in which the number of red blood cells, 
(RBCs) and consequently their oxygen-carrying capacity, is 
insufficient to meet the body’s physiological needs. Anemia is a 
significant public health challenge in India. It results from one or 
more of the following:
 ∙ Defective red cell production
 ∙ Increased red cell destruction or blood loss
